conclusion: The coefficient of kinetic friction between the bodies and the ground is given as μ = √3/6, and gravitational acceleration is g.
To find the normal force F exerted by the ground on body A, consider that body A is in equilibrium, so the sum of vertical forces must be zero.
The vertical forces acting on body A are the gravitational force and the normal force, hence F = mg.
To find the frictional force f, use the formula f = μF.
Substitute F = mg into the frictional force formula to get f = μmg = (√3/6)mg.
The magnitude of the normal force F exerted by the ground on body A is mg, and the magnitude of the frictional force f is (√3/6)mg.
